thread.title: Ground News - Hip-hop artist wins mother's property back after eminent domain attempt
thread.title_full: Ground News - Hip-hop artist wins mother's property back after eminent domain attempt

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Hip-hop artist wins mother's property back after eminent domain attempt
text:
Summary by Ground News Tauheed Rahim II bought a plot of grass near the St. Jude campus. The land was the center of drug activity and violence, said CRA executive director Andrew Murray. Subscribers to The Daily Memphian help fund our not-for-profit newsroom of nearly 40 local journalists. Share menu More
Filters 1 Articles 1 Articles All Left Center Right
The Daily Memphian Center Hip-hop artist wins mother's property back after eminent domain attempt Tauheed Rahim II, a native Memphian and artist-in-residence at Georgetown University in Washington, D.C., circulated a petition to maintain his rights to a problem property where his mother used to live near St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital.
7 hours ago Read Full Article
